characterWidth.description: Character width for automatically determining title max length.

format.description: The formatting pattern for axis labels.

grid.description: A flag indicate if gridlines should be created in addition to ticks. If `grid` is unspecified, the default value is `true` for ROW and COL. For X and Y, the default value is `true` for quantitative and time fields and `false` otherwise.

gridDash.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the grid dash array.

gridOpacity.description: The stroke opacity of grid (value between [0,1])

labelAngle.description: The rotation angle of the axis labels.

labelMaxLength.description: Truncate labels that are too long.

offset.description: The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the axis from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

orient.description: The orientation of the axis. One of top, bottom, left or right. The orientation can be used to further specialize the axis type (e.g., a y axis oriented for the right edge of the chart).

properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom axis styling.

shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month and day names should be abbreviated.

subdivide.description: If provided, sets the number of minor ticks between major ticks (the value 9 results in decimal subdivision). Only applicable for axes visualizing quantitative scales.

tickColor.description: The color of the axis's tick.

tickCount.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

tickLabelColor.description: The color of the tick label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

tickLabelFont.description: The font of the tick label.

tickLabelFontSize.description: The font size of label, in pixels.

tickPadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between ticks and text labels.

tickSize.description: The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

tickSizeEnd.description: The size, in pixels, of end ticks.

tickSizeMajor.description: The size, in pixels, of major ticks.

tickSizeMinor.description: The size, in pixels, of minor ticks.

tickWidth.description: The width, in pixels, of ticks.

title.description: A title for the axis. Shows field name and its function by default.

titleColor.description: Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

titleOffset.description: A title offset value for the axis.

zindex.description:
A non-positive integer indicating z-index of the axis.

If zindex is 0, axes should be drawn behind all chart elements.

To put them in front, use zindex = 1.

characterWidth.description: Character width for automatically determining title max length.

grid.description: A flag indicate if gridlines should be created in addition to ticks. If `grid` is unspecified, the default value is `true` for ROW and COL. For X and Y, the default value is `true` for quantitative and time fields and `false` otherwise.

gridDash.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the grid dash array.

gridOpacity.description: The stroke opacity of grid (value between [0,1])

labelAngle.description: The rotation angle of the axis labels.

labelMaxLength.description: Truncate labels that are too long.

offset.description: The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the axis from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom axis styling.

shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month and day names should be abbreviated.

subdivide.description: If provided, sets the number of minor ticks between major ticks (the value 9 results in decimal subdivision). Only applicable for axes visualizing quantitative scales.

tickColor.description: The color of the axis's tick.

tickCount.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

tickLabelColor.description: The color of the tick label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

tickLabelFont.description: The font of the tick label.

tickLabelFontSize.description: The font size of label, in pixels.

tickPadding.description: The padding, in pixels, between ticks and text labels.

tickSize.description: The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.

tickSizeEnd.description: The size, in pixels, of end ticks.

tickSizeMajor.description: The size, in pixels, of major ticks.

tickSizeMinor.description: The size, in pixels, of minor ticks.

tickWidth.description: The width, in pixels, of ticks.

titleColor.description: Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.

titleOffset.description: A title offset value for the axis.

zindex.description:
A non-positive integer indicating z-index of the axis.

If zindex is 0, axes should be drawn behind all chart elements.

To put them in front, use zindex = 1.

Bin.description: Binning properties or boolean flag for determining whether to bin data or not.

base.description: The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

div.description: Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

max.description: The maximum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the maximum value of the specified field is used.

min.description: The minimum bin value to consider. If unspecified, the minimum value of the specified field is used.

minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

step.description: An exact step size to use between bins. If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

bin.description:
Flag for binning a `quantitative` field, or a bin property object

for binning parameters.

field.description: Name of the field from which to pull a data value.

type.description:
The encoded field's type of measurement. This can be either a full type

name (`"quantitative"`, `"temporal"`, `"ordinal"`,  and `"nominal"`)

or an initial character of the type name (`"Q"`, `"T"`, `"O"`, `"N"`).

This property is case insensitive.

value.description: A constant value in visual domain.

background.description: CSS color property to use as background of visualization. Default is `"transparent"`.

countTitle.description: Default axis and legend title for count fields.

numberFormat.description: D3 Number format for axis labels and text tables. For example "s" for SI units.

timeFormat.description: Default datetime format for axis and legend labels. The format can be set directly on each axis and legend.

viewport.description: The width and height of the on-screen viewport, in pixels. If necessary, clipping and scrolling will be applied.

format.description: An object that specifies the format for the data file or values.

url.description:
A URL from which to load the data set. Use the format.type property

to ensure the loaded data is correctly parsed.

values.description: Pass array of objects instead of a url to a file.

feature.description:
The name of the TopoJSON object set to convert to a GeoJSON feature collection.

For example, in a map of the world, there may be an object set named `"countries"`.

Using the feature property, we can extract this set and generate a GeoJSON feature object for each country.

mesh.description:
The name of the TopoJSON object set to convert to a mesh.

Similar to the `feature` option, `mesh` extracts a named TopoJSON object set.

Unlike the `feature` option, the corresponding geo data is returned as a single, unified mesh instance, not as individual GeoJSON features.

Extracting a mesh is useful for more efficiently drawing borders or other geographic elements that you do not need to associate with specific regions such as individual countries, states or counties.

parse.description: A collection of parsing instructions can be used to define the data types of string-valued attributes in the JSON file. Each instruction is a name-value pair, where the name is the name of the attribute, and the value is the desired data type (one of `"number"`, `"boolean"` or `"date"`). For example, `"parse": {"modified_on":"date"}` ensures that the `modified_on` value in each row of the input data is parsed as a Date value. (See Datalib's [`dl.read.types` method](https://github.com/vega/datalib/wiki/Import#dl_read_types) for more information.)

property.description:
JSON only) The JSON property containing the desired data.

This parameter can be used when the loaded JSON file may have surrounding structure or meta-data.

For example `"property": "values.features"` is equivalent to retrieving `json.values.features`

from the loaded JSON object.

type.description:
Type of input data: `"json"`, `"csv"`, `"tsv"`.

The default format type is determined by the extension of the file url.

If no extension is detected, `"json"` will be used by default.

DateTime.description:
Object for defining datetime in Vega-Lite Filter.

If both month and quarter are provided, month has higher precedence.

`day` cannot be combined with other date.

We accept string for month and day names.

date.description: Integer value representing the date from 1-31.

day.description:
Value representing the day of week. This can be one of: (1) integer value -- `1` represents Monday; (2) case-insensitive day name (e.g., `"Monday"`); (3) case-insensitive, 3-character short day name (e.g., `"Mon"`).
**Warning:** A DateTime definition object with `day`** should not be combined with `year`, `quarter`, `month`, or `date`.

hours.description: Integer value representing the hour of day from 0-23.

milliseconds.description: Integer value representing millisecond segment of a time.

minutes.description: Integer value representing minute segment of a time from 0-59.

month.description: One of: (1) integer value representing the month from `1`-`12`. `1` represents January;  (2) case-insensitive month name (e.g., `"January"`);  (3) case-insensitive, 3-character short month name (e.g., `"Jan"`).

quarter.description: Integer value representing the quarter of the year (from 1-4).

seconds.description: Integer value representing second segment of a time from 0-59.

color.description:
Color of the marks – either fill or stroke color based on mark type.

(By default, fill color for `area`, `bar`, `tick`, `text`, `circle`, and `square` /

stroke color for `line` and `point`.)

detail.description:
Additional levels of detail for grouping data in aggregate views and

in line and area marks without mapping data to a specific visual channel.

opacity.description: Opacity of the marks – either can be a value or in a range.

order.description: Layer order for non-stacked marks, or stack order for stacked marks.

path.description: Order of data points in line marks.

shape.description:
The symbol's shape (only for `point` marks). The supported values are

`"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`,

or `"triangle-down"`, or else a custom SVG path string.

size.description:
Size of the mark.

- For `point`, `square` and `circle`

– the symbol size, or pixel area of the mark.

- For `bar` and `tick` – the bar and tick's size.

- For `text` – the text's font size.

- Size is currently unsupported for `line` and `area`.

x.description:
X coordinates for `point`, `circle`, `square`,

`line`, `rule`, `text`, and `tick`

(or to width and height for `bar` and `area` marks).

y.description:
Y coordinates for `point`, `circle`, `square`,

`line`, `rule`, `text`, and `tick`

(or to width and height for `bar` and `area` marks).

equal.description: Value that the field should be equal to.

timeUnit.description: Time unit for the field to be filtered.

ExtendedUnitSpec.description:
Schema for a unit Vega-Lite specification, with the syntactic sugar extensions:

- `row` and `column` are included in the encoding.

- (Future) label, box plot



Note: the spec could contain facet.

data.description: An object describing the data source

description.description:
An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

This property has no effect on the output visualization.

encoding.description: A key-value mapping between encoding channels and definition of fields.

mark.description:
The mark type.

One of `"bar"`, `"circle"`, `"square"`, `"tick"`, `"line"`,

`"area"`, `"point"`, `"rule"`, and `"text"`.

name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

transform.description: An object describing filter and new field calculation.

data.description: An object describing the data source

description.description:
An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

This property has no effect on the output visualization.

name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

transform.description: An object describing filter and new field calculation.

bin.description:
Flag for binning a `quantitative` field, or a bin property object

for binning parameters.

field.description: Name of the field from which to pull a data value.

type.description:
The encoded field's type of measurement. This can be either a full type

name (`"quantitative"`, `"temporal"`, `"ordinal"`,  and `"nominal"`)

or an initial character of the type name (`"Q"`, `"T"`, `"O"`, `"N"`).

This property is case insensitive.

value.description: A constant value in visual domain.

as.description: The field in which to store the computed formula value.

expr.description: A string containing an expression for the formula. Use the variable `datum` to to refer to the current data object.

data.description: An object describing the data source

description.description:
An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

This property has no effect on the output visualization.

layers.description: Unit specs that will be layered.

name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

transform.description: An object describing filter and new field calculation.

format.description: An optional formatting pattern for legend labels. Vega uses D3\'s format pattern.

gradientHeight.description: The height of the gradient, in pixels.

gradientStrokeColor.description: The color of the gradient stroke, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

gradientStrokeWidth.description: The width of the gradient stroke, in pixels.

gradientWidth.description: The width of the gradient, in pixels.

labelAlign.description: The alignment of the legend label, can be left, middle or right.

labelBaseline.description: The position of the baseline of legend label, can be top, middle or bottom.

labelColor.description: The color of the legend label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

labelFont.description: The font of the legend label.

labelFontSize.description: The font size of legend label.

labelOffset.description: The offset of the legend label.

margin.description: The margin around the legend, in pixels

offset.description: The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the legend from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

orient.description: The orientation of the legend. One of "left" or "right". This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is "right".

padding.description: The padding, in pixels, between the legend and axis.

properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.

shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.

symbolColor.description: The color of the legend symbol,

symbolShape.description:
The shape of the legend symbol, can be the 'circle', 'square', 'cross', 'diamond',

'triangle-up', 'triangle-down', or else a custom SVG path string.

symbolSize.description: The size of the legend symbol, in pixels.

symbolStrokeWidth.description: The width of the symbol's stroke.

title.description: A title for the legend. (Shows field name and its function by default.)

titleColor.description:
Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.

The color of the legend title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

titleFont.description: The font of the legend title.

titleFontSize.description: The font size of the legend title.

titleFontWeight.description: The font weight of the legend title.

values.description: Explicitly set the visible legend values.

gradientHeight.description: The height of the gradient, in pixels.

gradientStrokeColor.description: The color of the gradient stroke, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

gradientStrokeWidth.description: The width of the gradient stroke, in pixels.

gradientWidth.description: The width of the gradient, in pixels.

labelAlign.description: The alignment of the legend label, can be left, middle or right.

labelBaseline.description: The position of the baseline of legend label, can be top, middle or bottom.

labelColor.description: The color of the legend label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

labelFont.description: The font of the legend label.

labelFontSize.description: The font size of legend label.

labelOffset.description: The offset of the legend label.

margin.description: The margin around the legend, in pixels

offset.description: The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the legend from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.

orient.description: The orientation of the legend. One of "left" or "right". This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is "right".

padding.description: The padding, in pixels, between the legend and axis.

properties.description: Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.

shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.

symbolColor.description: The color of the legend symbol,

symbolShape.description:
The shape of the legend symbol, can be the 'circle', 'square', 'cross', 'diamond',

'triangle-up', 'triangle-down', or else a custom SVG path string.

symbolSize.description: The size of the legend symbol, in pixels.

symbolStrokeWidth.description: The width of the symbol's stroke.

titleColor.description:
Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.

The color of the legend title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.

titleFont.description: The font of the legend title.

titleFontSize.description: The font size of the legend title.

titleFontWeight.description: The font weight of the legend title.

align.description: The horizontal alignment of the text. One of left, right, center.

angle.description: The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.

applyColorToBackground.description: Apply color field to background color instead of the text.

barBinSpacing.description: Offset between bar for binned field

barSize.description:
The size of the bars.  If unspecified, the default size is  `bandSize-1`,

which provides 1 pixel offset between bars.

barThinSize.description: The size of the bars on continuous scales.

baseline.description: The vertical alignment of the text. One of top, middle, bottom.

dx.description: The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.

dy.description: The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.

fill.description: Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

filled.description:
Whether the shape\'s color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

This is only applicable for "bar", "point", and "area".

All marks except "point" marks are filled by default.

See Mark Documentation (http://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/marks.html)

for usage example.

font.description: The typeface to set the text in (e.g., Helvetica Neue).

format.description: The formatting pattern for text value. If not defined, this will be determined automatically.

interpolate.description: The line interpolation method to use. One of linear, step-before, step-after, basis, basis-open, cardinal, cardinal-open, monotone.

orient.description:
The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.

The value is either horizontal (default) or vertical.

- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tick

should be applied to x or y dimension.

- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.

- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the line

if `config.sortLineBy` is not specified.

For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stack;

therefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.

radius.description: Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties.

shape.description: The symbol shape to use. One of circle (default), square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down, or a custom SVG path.

shortTimeLabels.description: Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.

size.description: The pixel area each the point. For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.

stroke.description: Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.color

strokeDash.description: An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.

strokeDashOffset.description: The offset (in pixels) into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.

tension.description: Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter.

theta.description: Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties. Values for theta follow the same convention of arc mark startAngle and endAngle properties: angles are measured in radians, with 0 indicating "north".

oneOf.description:
A set of values that the `field`'s value should be a member of,

for a data item included in the filtered data.

timeUnit.description: time unit for the field to be filtered.

bin.description:
Flag for binning a `quantitative` field, or a bin property object

for binning parameters.

field.description: Name of the field from which to pull a data value.

type.description:
The encoded field's type of measurement. This can be either a full type

name (`"quantitative"`, `"temporal"`, `"ordinal"`,  and `"nominal"`)

or an initial character of the type name (`"Q"`, `"T"`, `"O"`, `"N"`).

This property is case insensitive.

value.description: A constant value in visual domain.

area.description: Type of overlay for area mark (line or linepoint)

line.description: Whether to overlay line with point.

lineStyle.description: Default style for the overlayed point.

pointStyle.description: Default style for the overlayed point.

bin.description:
Flag for binning a `quantitative` field, or a bin property object

for binning parameters.

field.description: Name of the field from which to pull a data value.

type.description:
The encoded field's type of measurement. This can be either a full type

name (`"quantitative"`, `"temporal"`, `"ordinal"`,  and `"nominal"`)

or an initial character of the type name (`"Q"`, `"T"`, `"O"`, `"N"`).

This property is case insensitive.

value.description: A constant value in visual domain.

range.description:
Array of inclusive minimum and maximum values

for a field value of a data item to be included in the filtered data.

timeUnit.description: time unit for the field to be filtered.

clamp.description: If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value

domain.description: The domain of the scale, representing the set of data values. For quantitative data, this can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal/categorical data, this may be an array of valid input values.

exponent.description: Sets the exponent of the scale transformation. For pow scale types only, otherwise ignored.

nice.description: If specified, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. If specified as a true boolean, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly number range (e.g., 7 instead of 6.96). If specified as a string, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. For time and utc scale types only, the nice value should be a string indicating the desired time interval.

padding.description: Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the __points__ parameter is `true`, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is 1.0, such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range [0, 1] and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of 0.5 means that the range band width will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the [D3 ordinal scale documentation](https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Ordinal-Scales).

range.description: The range of the scale, representing the set of visual values. For numeric values, the range can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal or quantized data, the range may by an array of desired output values, which are mapped to elements in the specified domain. For ordinal scales only, the range can be defined using a DataRef: the range values are then drawn dynamically from a backing data set.

round.description: If true, rounds numeric output values to integers. This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.

scheme.description: Color scheme that determines output color of a color scale.

useRawDomain.description:
Uses the source data range as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis.

This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain (`"mean"`, `"average"`, `"stdev"`, `"stdevp"`, `"median"`, `"q1"`, `"q3"`, `"min"`, `"max"`). For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain (e.g. `"count"`, `"sum"`), this property is ignored.

zero.description:
If `true`, ensures that a zero baseline value is included in the scale domain.

Default value: `true` for `x` and `y` channel if the quantitative field is not binned

and no custom `domain` is provided; `false` otherwise.

bandPadding.description: Default padding for `x` and `y` band-ordinal scales.

bandSize.description:
Default band size for (1) `y` ordinal scale,

and (2) `x` ordinal scale when the mark is not `text`.

barSizeRange.description: Default range for bar size scale

clamp.description: If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value

fontSizeRange.description: Default range for font size scale

nominalColorScheme.description: Default color scheme for nominal (categorical) data

pointPadding.description: Default padding for `x` and `y` point-ordinal scales.

pointSizeRange.description: Default range for bar size scale

round.description:
If true, rounds numeric output values to integers.

This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.

(Only available for `x`, `y`, `size`, `row`, and `column` scales.)

ruleSizeRange.description: Default range for rule stroke widths

sequentialColorScheme.description: Default color scheme for ordinal, quantitative and temporal field

textBandWidth.description: Default band width for `x` ordinal scale when is mark is `text`.

useRawDomain.description:
Uses the source data range as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis.

This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain (`"mean"`, `"average"`, `"stdev"`, `"stdevp"`, `"median"`, `"q1"`, `"q3"`, `"min"`, `"max"`). For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain (e.g. `"count"`, `"sum"`), this property is ignored.

field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

calculate.description: Calculate new field(s) using the provided expresssion(s). Calculation are applied before filter.

filter.description: A string containing the filter Vega expression. Use `datum` to refer to the current data object.

filterInvalid.description: Whether to filter invalid values (`null` and `NaN`) from the data. By default (`undefined`), only quantitative and temporal fields are filtered. If set to `true`, all data items with null values are filtered. If `false`, all data items are included.

color.description:
Color of the marks – either fill or stroke color based on mark type.

(By default, fill color for `area`, `bar`, `tick`, `text`, `circle`, and `square` /

stroke color for `line` and `point`.)

detail.description:
Additional levels of detail for grouping data in aggregate views and

in line and area marks without mapping data to a specific visual channel.

opacity.description: Opacity of the marks – either can be a value or in a range.

order.description: Layer order for non-stacked marks, or stack order for stacked marks.

path.description: Order of data points in line marks.

shape.description:
The symbol's shape (only for `point` marks). The supported values are

`"circle"` (default), `"square"`, `"cross"`, `"diamond"`, `"triangle-up"`,

or `"triangle-down"`, or else a custom SVG path string.

size.description:
Size of the mark.

- For `point`, `square` and `circle`

– the symbol size, or pixel area of the mark.

- For `bar` and `tick` – the bar and tick's size.

- For `text` – the text's font size.

- Size is currently unsupported for `line` and `area`.

x.description:
X coordinates for `point`, `circle`, `square`,

`line`, `rule`, `text`, and `tick`

(or to width and height for `bar` and `area` marks).

y.description:
Y coordinates for `point`, `circle`, `square`,

`line`, `rule`, `text`, and `tick`

(or to width and height for `bar` and `area` marks).

data.description: An object describing the data source

description.description:
An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.

This property has no effect on the output visualization.

encoding.description: A key-value mapping between encoding channels and definition of fields.

mark.description:
The mark type.

One of `"bar"`, `"circle"`, `"square"`, `"tick"`, `"line"`,

`"area"`, `"point"`, `"rule"`, and `"text"`.

name.description: Name of the visualization for later reference.

transform.description: An object describing filter and new field calculation.
